sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: In an isosceles triangle, the length of both of the congruent sides is 10 cm. If the length of the third side is 12 cm longer than the length of the congruent sides, what is the length of the third side?
message_2:
If the length of the congruent sides is 10 cm, and the third side is 12 cm longer than the congruent sides, then the length of the third side is:

10 cm + 12 cm = 22 cm

The length of the third side is 22 cm.
